intro: Chenopodium hircinum subsp. milleanum, commonly known as the milleanum goosefoot, is a species of flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile, and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. The plant has alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, dry fruits known as utricles. This subspecies is adapted to arid environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
